title: How to Make Russian Crackers with Dried Fruit
category_hierarchy: Crackers and Savory Cookies and Biscuits

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 200 °C (392 °F).
steps.description: Put the baking tray away from the oven and cover it with parchment paper.

steps.headline: Make the dough.
steps.description: Put butter and flour into a medium deep bowl and stir all ingredients with a wooden spoon or a fork or with a broom.

steps.headline: Add eggs and sugar to this mixture.
steps.description: Stir the mixture. When you have stirred the mixture, knead it until the dough get easy off from your hands. If the dough is still sticky, add a little more flour.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the table with flour, take the dough out of the bowl and divide it into 4 parts.
Put into every part additives which you like.
steps.description: Dried fruits and nuts should be cut in little pieces.

steps.headline: Knead every part with additives one more time
Make from each part of dough a "sausage".
Place the "sausages" on the baking tray.
steps.description: Leave room between "sausages". If they are replaced too close together, it will be uncomfortable to cut them later and to turn the crackers over.

steps.headline: In 10-15 minutes take the baking tray out of the oven.
steps.description: When you see that "sausages" are fried thoroughly, take the baking tray out and cut the "sausages" in little peaces (2-3 cm). Now turn your little peaces (crackers) on a flank.

steps.headline: Place the baking tray  again in the oven and bake it for 10-15 minutes more.
Remove your sweet, yummy and healthy (thanks dried fruits and nuts) crackers from the oven and allow them cool and reach room temperature.
Enjoy with your little helpers your homemade delicate sweet and healthy crackers!

text: Preheat the oven to 200 °C (392 °F). Put the baking tray away from the oven and cover it with parchment paper. Make the dough. Put butter and flour into a medium deep bowl and stir all ingredients with a wooden spoon or a fork or with a broom. Add eggs and sugar to this mixture. Stir the mixture. When you have stirred the mixture, knead it until the dough get easy off from your hands. If the dough is still sticky, add a little more flour. Sprinkle the table with flour, take the dough out of the bowl and divide it into 4 parts.  Put into every part additives which you like. Dried fruits and nuts should be cut in little pieces. Knead every part with additives one more time  Make from each part of dough a "sausage". It shouldn't be very thin. Place the "sausages" on the baking tray. Leave room between "sausages". If they are replaced too close together, it will be uncomfortable to cut them later and to turn the crackers over. In 10-15 minutes take the baking tray out of the oven. When you see that "sausages" are fried thoroughly, take the baking tray out and cut the "sausages" in little peaces (2-3 cm). Now turn your little peaces (crackers) on a flank. Place the baking tray  again in the oven and bake it for 10-15 minutes more.  Remove your sweet, yummy and healthy (thanks dried fruits and nuts) crackers from the oven and allow them cool and reach room temperature.  Enjoy with your little helpers your homemade delicate sweet and healthy crackers!  Finished.
